freeTeeth

Correct your smile on your time, for less. freeTeeth is bringing open source 3D scanning and printing to the world of corrective retainers. We want to help you get that perfect smile for a fraction of the cost.

Learn more

Our Vision

The current cost of Invisalign and related products in the United States ranges from $3,500 to $8,000 with the national average at about $5,000. This is much more than the cost of materials to create these products. Our goal is to harness emerging technologies such as 3D printing and scanning to make the process of obtaining and using corrective retainers something everyone can afford. This will be accomplished by using graphical software to model a user’s teeth, suggest alignment corrections, and finally 3D print a plastic retainer.

Open Source

This project is fully open source. The goal from start to finish will be to save the end user money. We hope the communities of graphics and 3D printing enthusiasts will contribute to create high powered tools and solutions.

Get Started

Ready to have the smile you've always wanted? Click here to get started with your impression and 3D model.

Learn More

Methods & Research

Take a look under the hood at how our application manipulates a 3D model of your teeth. Dive deeper with our research into single-tooth modeling from a 3D model.

Learn More

Get Involved

Are you passionate about graphics, coding, or both? We need your help! We are looking for members of the open source community to help make our dreams a reality and our code robust. Click here to learn more about contributing to the freeTeeth project.

Learn More
